|   | A talisman to be worn as jewellery around the neck, charged with arcane powers of unknown provenance.***“Gringoire put out his hand for the little bag, but she drew back. 'Do not touch it! It is an amulet, and either you will do mischief to the charm, or it will hurt you.'” -Victor Marie Hugo, \_Notre Dame de Paris\_, Book II, chapter VII “A Wedding Night”. 1831. |

An **amulet** is a type of [jewellery](/Jewellery "Jewellery"). Regardless of [species](/Species "Species"), all characters may wear only one amulet at a time. Some amulets require attunement to the wearer to begin functioning, but all amulets require 5 turns to put on or take off to discourage swapping mid-battle.

There are six base types of amulets:

- [![Amulet of the acrobat.png](/images/a/ae/Amulet_of_the_acrobat.png)](/File:Amulet_of_the_acrobat.png) **[Amulet of the acrobat](/Amulet_of_the_acrobat "Amulet of the acrobat")**: Increases [EV](/EV "EV") by 15, but only while you are moving or waiting.
- [![Amulet of faith.png](/images/2/29/Amulet_of_faith.png)](/File:Amulet_of_faith.png) **[Amulet of faith](/Amulet_of_faith "Amulet of faith")**: Increases [piety](/Piety "Piety") gain by 25% and gift drop rate by 33%, but causes you to lose 33% of your piety when unequipped.
- [![Amulet of guardian spirit.png](/images/1/10/Amulet_of_guardian_spirit.png)](/File:Amulet_of_guardian_spirit.png) **[Amulet of guardian spirit](/Amulet_of_guardian_spirit "Amulet of guardian spirit")**: Grants [spirit shield](/Spirit_shield "Spirit shield"), dividing damage taken between HP and MP.
- [![Amulet of magic regeneration.png](/images/5/5b/Amulet_of_magic_regeneration.png)](/File:Amulet_of_magic_regeneration.png) **[Amulet of magic regeneration](/Amulet_of_magic_regeneration "Amulet of magic regeneration")**: Increases MP regeneration rate by 0.4 per turn; requires attunement at full MP.
- [![Amulet of reflection.png](/images/a/a3/Amulet_of_reflection.png)](/File:Amulet_of_reflection.png) **[Amulet of reflection](/Amulet_of_reflection "Amulet of reflection")**: Increases the player's [SH](/SH "SH") score by 5 and grants the [reflection](/Reflection "Reflection") ego.
- [![Amulet of regeneration.png](/images/1/18/Amulet_of_regeneration.png)](/File:Amulet_of_regeneration.png) **[Amulet of regeneration](/Amulet_of_regeneration "Amulet of regeneration")**: Increases HP [regeneration rate](/Regeneration_rate "Regeneration rate") by 0.8 per turn; requires attunement at full HP.

[Random artefact](/Randart "Randart") amulets use one of these base types, but contain additonal properties. However, a few [unrand amulets](/List_of_unrands#Amulets "List of unrands") don't have a base type.

## Obsolete Amulets

- **[Amulet of inaccuracy](/Amulet_of_inaccuracy "Amulet of inaccuracy")** (removed in [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"))
- **[Amulet of harm](/Amulet_of_harm "Amulet of harm")** (removed in [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"); [harm](/Harm "Harm") ego moved to [scarves](/Scarves "Scarves") and [randart](/Randart "Randart") armour)
- **[Amulet of the gourmand](/Amulet_of_the_gourmand "Amulet of the gourmand")** (removed in [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"))
- **[Amulet of rage](/Amulet_of_rage "Amulet of rage")** (removed in [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"))
- **[Amulet of resist mutation](/Amulet_of_resist_mutation "Amulet of resist mutation")** (removed in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"))
- **[Amulet of resist corrosion](/Amulet_of_resist_corrosion "Amulet of resist corrosion")** (replaced by [ring of resist corrosion](/Ring_of_resist_corrosion "Ring of resist corrosion") in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"))
- **[Amulet of stasis](/Amulet_of_stasis "Amulet of stasis")** (removed in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"))
- **[Amulet of warding](/Amulet_of_warding "Amulet of warding")** (removed in [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"))
- **[Amulet of conservation](/Amulet_of_conservation "Amulet of conservation")** (removed in [0.15](/0.15 "0.15"))
- **[Amulet of controlled flight](/Amulet_of_controlled_flight "Amulet of controlled flight")** (removed in [0.11](/0.11 "0.11"))
- **[Amulet of resist slowing](/Amulet_of_resist_slowing "Amulet of resist slowing")** (replaced with [amulet of stasis](/Amulet_of_stasis "Amulet of stasis") in [0.6](/0.6 "0.6"))

## History

- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), equipping an amulet required only 0.5 turns instead of 5 turns. Also, amulets of the acrobat and reflection required attunement to the wearer to begin functioning.

Amulet

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
A talisman to be worn as jewellery around the neck, charged with arcane powers of unknown provenance.

“Gringoire put out his hand for the little bag, but she drew back. 'Do not touch it! It is an amulet, and either you will do mischief to the charm, or it will hurt you.'”
-Victor Marie Hugo, _Notre Dame de Paris_, Book II, chapter VII “A Wedding Night”. 1831.

An amulet is a type of jewellery. Regardless of species, all characters may wear only one amulet at a time. Some amulets require attunement to the wearer to begin functioning, but all amulets require 5 turns to put on or take off to discourage swapping mid-battle.

There are six base types of amulets:

  • Amulet of the acrobat: Increases EV by 15, but only while you are moving or waiting.
  • Amulet of faith: Increases piety gain by 25% and gift drop rate by 33%, but causes you to lose 33% of your piety when unequipped.
  • Amulet of guardian spirit: Grants spirit shield, dividing damage taken between HP and MP.
  • Amulet of magic regeneration: Increases MP regeneration rate by 0.4 per turn; requires attunement at full MP.
  • Amulet of reflection: Increases the player's SH score by 5 and grants the reflection ego.
  • Amulet of regeneration: Increases HP regeneration rate by 0.8 per turn; requires attunement at full HP.

Random artefact amulets use one of these base types, but contain additonal properties. However, a few unrand amulets don't have a base type.

Obsolete Amulets

  • Amulet of inaccuracy (removed in 0.27)
  • Amulet of harm (removed in 0.25; harm ego moved to scarves and randart armour)
  • Amulet of the gourmand (removed in 0.25)
  • Amulet of rage (removed in 0.25)
  • Amulet of resist mutation (removed in 0.18)
  • Amulet of resist corrosion (replaced by ring of resist corrosion in 0.18)
  • Amulet of stasis (removed in 0.18)
  • Amulet of warding (removed in 0.18)
  • Amulet of conservation (removed in 0.15)
  • Amulet of controlled flight (removed in 0.11)
  • Amulet of resist slowing (replaced with amulet of stasis in 0.6)

History

  • Prior to 0.26, equipping an amulet required only 0.5 turns instead of 5 turns. Also, amulets of the acrobat and reflection required attunement to the wearer to begin functioning.
